thread.title: IBM’s Watson supercomputer to open second office near Silicon Valley
thread.title_full: IBM’s Watson supercomputer to open second office near Silicon Valley

author: Seattle Times staff
title: IBM’s Watson supercomputer to open second office near Silicon Valley
text:
IBM’s Watson supercomputer to open second office near Silicon Valley Originally published September 27, 2015 at 8:00 pm Updated September 27, 2015 at 2:15 pm The supercomputer, which represents one of the most advanced investments in artificial intelligence, has improved in key areas in the past few years. Los Angeles Times (TNS) 
Watson, IBM’s supercomputer that famously competed on the television show “Jeopardy!,” is coming west. 
The technology giant said last week it planned to open a second headquarters in San Francisco early next year for the project, which represents one of the most advanced investments in artificial intelligence. 
The move, which includes giving developers access to Watson’s technologies, will help Armonk, N.Y.-based IBM connect with data scientists and startups in Silicon Valley. 
The San Francisco Bay Area has emerged as a world center in artificial intelligence and machine learning. One result: voice recognition on smartphones. Most Read Stories
